alert.note: Alert for Logan; Mingo (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Mingo and western Logan Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 557 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Holden, or 8 miles southwest of Logan, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Logan, Chapmanville, Delbarton, Chief Logan State, Holden, Mount Gay-Shamrock, West Logan, Mitchell Heights, Mount Gay, Verdunville, Chauncey, Myrtle, Switzer and Dingess. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 8 and 36. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
